intro: Aegiphila congesta, commonly known as the clustered aegiphila, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems, and bloom during the dry season. Aegiphila congesta is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests.
